articles.headline: To Have and to Hold
articles.snippet: Making the right call when giving a cellphone — no one wants to be surprised with one that, like an older brother’s sweater, just doesn’t fit.
articles.abstract: Making the right call when giving a cellphone — no one wants to be surprised with one that, like an older brother’s sweater, just doesn’t fit.
articles.lead_paragraph: BUYING a phone is hard. Buying a phone for someone else can be even harder.

articles.headline: Keeping It Light
articles.snippet: The netbook could be considered the Honda Fit of computing: manageable in size, light of weight, handsome in an understated way, efficient and affordable.

articles.headline: Afghan Strategy Poses Stiff Challenge for Obama
articles.snippet: Experts caution that a troop increase in Afghanistan is unlikely to lead to the sort of turnaround seen in Iraq.
articles.abstract: Experts caution that a troop increase in Afghanistan is unlikely to lead to the sort of turnaround seen in Iraq.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  One of the most difficult challenges President-elect Barack Obama’s national security team faces is Mr. Obama’s vow to send thousands of American troops to help defeat the Taliban in Afghanistan.

articles.headline: Hot Food, and Air, at Bus Stops
articles.snippet: Heated air will warm 10 Chicago bus shelters, courtesy of the Stove Top brand of stuffing. Such marketing is meant to entice consumers to experience products tangibly.
articles.abstract: Heated air will warm 10 Chicago bus shelters, courtesy of the Stove Top brand of stuffing. Such marketing is meant to entice consumers to experience products tangibly.
articles.lead_paragraph: CRITICS claim that advertising is just a lot of hot air. For the next month, at certain bus stops, they will have a point.

articles.headline: Bailout Monitor Sees Lack of a Coherent Plan
articles.snippet: The head of a new Congressional panel set up to monitor the federal bailout says the government still does not seem to have a coherent strategy for easing the crisis.
articles.abstract: The head of a new Congressional panel set up to monitor the federal bailout says the government still does not seem to have a coherent strategy for easing the crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: The head of a new Congressional panel set up to monitor the gigantic federal bailout says the government still does not seem to have a coherent strategy for easing the financial crisis, despite the billions it has already spent in that effort.

articles.headline: Big Three May Need to Trim Number of Brands
articles.snippet: For automakers to win over lawmakers in their bid for aid, they will have to prove that they are serious about shrinking their vast lineups of different models.
articles.abstract: For automakers to win over lawmakers in their bid for aid, they will have to prove that they are serious about shrinking their vast lineups of different models.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT  For the Big Three automakers to win over Washington lawmakers in their bid for federal aid, they will have to address a critical question in the business plans they give to Congress on Tuesday.

articles.headline: Pardon Is Back in Focus for the Justice Nominee
articles.snippet: Eric H. Holder Jr., Barack Obama’s choice to be attorney general, was more deeply involved in the 2001 pardon of Marc Rich than his supporters acknowledge.
articles.abstract: Eric H. Holder Jr., Barack Obama’s choice to be attorney general, was more deeply involved in the 2001 pardon of Marc Rich than his supporters acknowledge.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  In the much praised career of Eric H. Holder Jr., President-elect Barack Obama’s choice to be attorney general, there is one notable blemish: Mr. Holder’s complicated role in the 2001 pardon of Marc Rich, a billionaire financier who had fled the country rather than face federal tax evasion charges.
articles.byline: By Eric Lichtblau and David Johnston

articles.headline: Putting a Value on a C.E.O.
articles.snippet: For better or worse, you, fellow taxpayer, are an investor in Citigroup and other banks. You have a vested interest in Citigroup’s success. If this giant falls, we all lose.
articles.abstract: For better or worse, you, fellow taxpayer, are an investor in Citigroup and other banks. You have a vested interest in Citigroup’s success. If this giant falls, we all lose.
articles.lead_paragraph: Wall Street often portrays itself as a pay-for-performance meritocracy. The rules are supposed to be simple: Make money, and you get rich. Lose it, and you get fired.

articles.headline: U.S. Is Said to Expand Tax Inquiry
articles.snippet: The Justice Department has expanded its investigation into foreign banks that sell offshore banking services to include Credit Suisse and HSBC, according to people briefed on the matter.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department has expanded its investigation into foreign banks that sell offshore banking services to include Credit Suisse and HSBC, according to people briefed on the matter.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department has expanded its criminal investigation into foreign banks that sell offshore private banking services to include Credit Suisse and HSBC, according to people briefed on the matter.

articles.headline: For Heroes of Mumbai, Terror Was a Call to Action
articles.snippet: Ordinary citizens displayed extraordinary grace during one of the most horrific terrorist attacks in India’s history.
articles.abstract: Ordinary citizens displayed extraordinary grace during one of the most horrific terrorist attacks in India’s history.
articles.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI, India  On any ordinary day, Vishnu Datta Ram Zende used the public-address system at Mumbai’s largest railway station to direct busy hordes of travelers to their trains.

articles.headline: U.S. and India See Link to Militants in Pakistan
articles.snippet: Officials said they had identified leaders of the terrorist attacks in Mumbai, stepping up pressure on Pakistan.
